comments: I'm afraid I have fallen down a rabbit hole of camera apps. I love what they have done with the options and filters. The app itself performs admirably but I am very suspicious of their business model. There are intrusive ads that want you to install other camera apps and camera related utilities which appear to be written by a small group of friends. It's like a tight-knit group of developers bouncing you between themselves to get higher installs and higher ratings. I suppose that is something they can do to game the system for money. Some of the camera apps I found (before I gave up) was Selfie Camera, HD Camera, Professional HD Camera, Beauty Camera, and Gallery Photo Slideshow. ALL of the camera apps seem to use the same template with cosmetic differences only. They ALL seem to function the exact same way. For some reason, there is not a way to actually purchase any of these apps and utilities to remove the self serving ads. VERY suspicious. Within the apps themselves, they don't identify themselves. Install one of the cameras, go look into the settings (or anywhere else) and there is nothing to tell you what you have installed. More suspicious. I now have a row of camera apps that identify on the screen only as "Camera". What are they doing? What are they hiding? I am going to uninstall all of these camera apps that I experimented with and do a full security sweep. Like I said, I really like what they have done but if I can't buy my way out of the intrusive ads, I'm not going to fuss with any of them.

I just downloaded it and I tried to take a picture, it was way better than my original camera, unfortunately when i try to take a video, i can only hear is the sound but my reflection on the cmera is not moving

Very high resolution camera for photos and videos. Much better than my original Android camera. For to be perfect, only need a way to open the camera quickly, while the screen is lock. When I try to do this, my phone opens the original camera, though I had configurated to open this professional camera.

Outstanding HD Camera to use. Crystal clear pictures as long as it's not very close. If the picture is very close you have to tap your monitor several times to get it to focus, sometimes it doesn't work.
Really a good one, was not expecting it to be so good and functional.. Easy to use simplicity is always key. Good app

title: Color Grab (color detection)
description:
Color Grab is the ultimate on-the-go color tool. Pick, capture and recognize colors simply by pointing the camera.
Leading and worldwide used by designers, artists, professionals, developers, scientists and color-blinds.

#1 MUST HAVE APP FOR DESIGNERS & ARTISTS. FREE!


KEY FEATURES:
●  Real-time color measurement (color metering)
●  Color Palette Generator. 
●  Extract colors and maps from your photos.
●  Color recognition (color-2-name).
●  Real-time calibration mode - use reference white object.
●  Custom white balance.
●  Color palettes and harmonies themes generation tool.
●  Colors blending tool - mix colors.
●  Tune tool - refine your colors.
●  Find the perfect color combinations.
●  Discover and reveal matching colors.
●  Color locking indication.
●  "Instant Picking" - tap-2-capture.
●  Viewfinder smart processing.
●  Supports most-common color models (RGB, HEX, HSV, LAB, see below).
●  After-shot color analysis.
●  Export to popular applications such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Excel, CSV, PaintShop, Gimp, Inkscape, AutoCAD, Datasheets, etc.
●  Color conversions.
●  Accessibility; hear the color by pressing the volume buttons.
●  Copy color to clipboard. 
●  Share and post color cards as image or text.
●  Paint your wallpaper background with a solid color.

ADDITIONAL CONTROLS:
●  Turn flash light in low-light conditions.
●  Smart color stabilizer.
●  Smart color locking mechanism.
●  Motion-sensed auto-focus.

●  Camera switching (use rear or front).

comments: This app has changed my life, or at least the way I buy bananas. I am colorblind and I used to buy bananas and try one. If it was crunchy(as they usually were), I would wait one day and try a second! Since getting this app, I have not HAD to eat a single green banana (I sometimes do because I have had to get used to them). I also use it to pick out clothing and make sure I am not unintentionally buying something pink. I do buy pink sometimes, but I only like it if it is intentional.

VERY disappointed in this new version! ZERO instructions anywhere. WHERE are the recorded colors (if it records them). All the wonderful features in the Play description are accessed HOW?! Not via any menu I can find. All I can access is the "Capture" screen as shown on the left in the description images.; the other screens are nowhere to be found, via anywhere or any icon I click ?? That's all that shows. ?***ALSO****, like many other Apps in the Play Store, HOW MUCH DOES THE UPGRADE COST???? PLEASE be transparent and SAY what it costs before pressing the Purchase button! One dollar? Ten dollars? 29 dollars??? What!? Pretty angry - with NO instructions and NO cost transparency. I'll chage to 5 stars if I am missing something obvious.

This is an impressive app! It gives an extremely detailed analysis of the accurate color(s) of whatever item you are scanning for color matching. This is going to make painting, decorating and color coordination easier and more precise than ever. I am actually excited to go get paint that's going to match even the oddest and rarest colors I can come up with.

Nice app. The info/instruction pop-ups make it easy to get started. Useful option to pair the color hex for a specific brand of paint (ie. valspar). Color hex saved under paint can icon (chk instructions). Ads not intrusive, option to purchase app came up once; will decide after I try out more options.

I downloaded this app in hopes to solve a disagreement between my boyfriend and I over the true color of a paint swatch, thats how I discovered this awesome little tool. It never before occurred to me just how useful such an app could be. The applications in which I can see myself applying this handy little tool are pretty endless. Overall it's a great app if you're serious about color identification and ease of use. Its guaranteed to please. I'm definitely going to have fun on this Color Grab.

- Fast: 1 hour Walmart pickup

title: PhotoCircle
description:
Capture your memories in shared albums. It's fast, private, and simple. Create albums for all occasions: weddings, birthdays, vacations, families, and classrooms. Join a friend’s album or start a new one. There’s no limit to the number of photos or videos you can add or friends you can invite, and only members of the album can add and view. 
  
Create albums for sharing:
• Newborn baby with grandparents
• Birthday celebration with friends
• Wedding photos with family & friends
• Classroom activities with parents
• Puppy or kitten cuteness with your significant other
• Vacations and holidays with loved ones 
• Life’s special moments…
  
Available on Android and iOS. Photo resolution up to 2048x2048 (4 megapixel). Videos up to 10 seconds in length. Media is securely and privately backed up to the cloud. Web/desktop coming soon!

comments: The app has gone through it's big break, with ads now (not a crazy ton,, they're always out of the way and rarely pop up) and a way better experience. Of course, updating apps comes with it's glitches, so here's a story. I had some glitches and went to the Support/feedback section, thinking nothing would happen, but I should at least try. An HOUR later, they came back to me saying they will fix that issue. What a great bunch of people who really know how to run a social media platform.

I was loving this app as I don't do Facebook or any other social media, but want to share pictures of my granddaughter with family and friends. Lately, however, the app is not showing my complete gallery albums, especially more recent pictures, so I'm unable to post new photos. Also, I've never been able to get videos to post. I do think paying to get rid of the ads is rather expensive, but I was considering it until these recent issues. What good is it if I can't post what I want?

It's not that useful for two reasons. First, you cannot sort and isolate just the photos from one circle-contributor and download those. Second, the Metadata is lost so the downloaded pictures can only be sorted by the photocircle date uploaded.

This app was amazing years ago, but now I regret storing so many photos in this app because the ads keep getting worse and worse. I understand the need to make money and didn't mind ads I can scroll past, but the ads that can't be closed until after 5 seconds or that automatically play with volume even after navigating away to another screen are now making me look into alternatives. For $7.99/year for no ads, I could be using something much better for that price.

Update: Ads are still horrible. This is about money. They get more money the more instrusive the ads are. God forbid you are somewhere quiet or public when this app decides to start blasting "pirate battle" or whatever. Constant ads make this app worthless! They pop up, fullscreen, playing sound, no way to close - forces you to app store for some dumb game you're not interested in at all.
